docs.lead_paragraph: A weekly unemployment figure suggested that the labor market recovery was gaining speed, but economic growth in the third quarter was revised downward.

headline.seo: Unemployment Claims Drop, but Economic Growth Is Slower
headline.main: Jobless Claims Drop, but 3rd-Quarter Growth Is Revised Down
headline.print_headline: Jobless Claims Drop, but 3rd-Quarter Growth Is Revised Down

docs.abstract: Labor Department reports that initial claims for state unemployment benefits dropped 4,000 to a seasonally adjusted 364,000, lowest number since April 2008; Commerce Department reports in final estimate that gross domestic product grew at a 1.8 percent annual rate in the July-September quarter, down from the previously estimated 2 percent.
docs.snippet: A weekly unemployment figure suggested that the labor market recovery was gaining speed, but economic growth in the third quarter was revised downward.

docs.lead_paragraph: A news analysis article on Wednesday about health care legislation that would leave many decisions to the states described a plan to address inconsistencies in health coverage from state to state incorrectly. The Obama administration intends to allow states to use a standard insurance plan as a benchmark for benefits until 2016, when it would determine which state-mandated benefits are not essential and must be either paid for by states or no longer mandated. It is not the case that the administration would establish a national standard of essential benefits in 2016.
docs.snippet: A news analysis article on Wednesday about health care legislation that would leave many decisions to the states described a plan to address inconsistencies in health coverage from state to state incorrectly. The Obama administration intends to allow...

headline.main: Is Americans' Religious Freedom Under Threat?

docs.abstract: In airports, classrooms and doctors' offices, Christians and religious minorities say, Americans are falling short of the founders' First Amendment ideals.
docs.snippet: In airports, classrooms and doctors' offices, Christians and religious minorities say, Americans are falling short of the founders' First Amendment ideals.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thousands of nurses plan to hold a one-day strike on Thursday over contract disputes between the California nurses’ union and two health care organizations.

headline.main: California: Nurses Plan One-Day Strike Over Contracts
headline.print_headline: California: Nurses Plan One-Day Strike Over Contracts

docs.abstract: Thousands of nurses plan to hold a one-day strike over contract disputes between the California nurses’ union and two health care organizations, Sutter Health and a Long Beach hospital system.
docs.snippet: Thousands of nurses plan to hold a one-day strike on Thursday over contract disputes between the California nurses’ union and two health care organizations.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Catto’s was director of the United States Information Agency, a chief Pentagon spokesman and ambassador to Britain and El Salvador.

headline.seo: Henry E. Catto Jr., Who Served 4 Presidents, Dies at 81
headline.main: Henry E. Catto Jr., Who Served 4 Presidents, Dies at 81

docs.abstract: Henry E Catto Jr, who was tapped by four Republican presidents for high-profile jobs including director of the United States Information Agency, chief Pentagon spokesman and ambassador to Britain and El Salvador, dies at age 81.
docs.snippet: Mr. Catto’s was director of the United States Information Agency, a chief Pentagon spokesman and ambassador to Britain and El Salvador.

docs.lead_paragraph: Real congressmen don’t vacation, not when there is important business to do for the people!
docs.abstract: Gail Collins Op-Ed column chastises United States Congressmen for using vacations as an excuse for not dealing with the payroll tax, unemployment and Medicare.
docs.snippet: Real congressmen don’t vacation, not when there is important business to do for the people!

docs.lead_paragraph: The patient needed hospice care, but the system simply wouldn’t allow it unless we were certain that she would die within six days.

headline.main: Looking for a Place to Die
headline.print_headline: Looking for a Place to Die

docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by oncology nurse Theresa Brown highlights the cruel complexities of hospice care coverage, which will not allow some patients to receive inpatient care because they are not close enough to death to qualify.
docs.snippet: The patient needed hospice care, but the system simply wouldn’t allow it unless we were certain that she would die within six days.

docs.lead_paragraph: Walgreen, in a payment battle with Express Scripts, said it had failed to get most of its customers who use Express Scripts to switch to another benefit manager.

headline.seo: Walgreen Faces Loss of Millions of Pharmacy Customers
headline.main: Walgreen Facing Big Loss in Fight With Express Scripts
headline.print_headline: Walgreen Facing Big Loss In Fight With Express Scripts

docs.abstract: Walgreen, in a payment battle with pharmacy benefits manager Express Scripts, says it has failed to get most of its customers who use Express Scripts to switch to another benefit manager; barring a last-minute agreement, the relationship will end Jan. 1, 2012, and Walgreen faces the loss of millions of customers.
docs.snippet: Walgreen, in a payment battle with Express Scripts, said it had failed to get most of its customers who use Express Scripts to switch to another benefit manager.
